questions.question:
A user needs to quickly deploy a non-relational database on AWS. The user does not want to manage the underlying hardware or the database software.
Which AWS service can be used to accomplish this?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service. AWS manages the infrastructure, scaling, patching, and availability, allowing the user to deploy a non-relational database without managing servers or database software.

questions.question:
A Cloud Practitioner is developing a disaster recovery plan and intends to replicate data between multiple geographic areas.
Which of the following meets these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are geographically separate locations. Replicating data between Regions provides protection against regional outages and supports disaster recovery strategies.

questions.question: Which features and benefits does the AWS Organizations service provide? (Choose two.)

options.text: Establishing real-time communications between members of an internal team
Facilitating the use of NoSQL databases
Enforcing the governance of AWS accounts

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows multiple AWS accounts to be managed together. It provides consolidated billing and lets administrators enforce governance through Service Control Policies (SCPs).

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to automate configuration management using Chef and Puppet?
questions.explanation: AWS OpsWorks provides managed Chef and Puppet services that help automate configuration management, application deployment, and server setup.

questions.question: Which tool is best suited for combining the billing of AWS accounts that were previously independent from one another?
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows multiple AWS accounts to be linked under one payer account so their costs are combined and volume discounts can be applied.

questions.question: The AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator is used to:

options.text: receive reports that break down AWS Cloud compute costs by duration, resource, or tags
estimate savings when comparing the AWS Cloud to an on-premises environment
estimate a monthly bill for the AWS Cloud resources that will be used
enable billing alerts to monitor actual AWS costs compared to estimated costs

questions.explanation: The TCO Calculator compares the cost of running workloads on AWS with running them on-premises, helping estimate potential savings.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to provide network connectivity between an on-premises network and a VPC? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private connection from on-premises to AWS, and AWS VPN provides encrypted connectivity over the internet. Both enable hybrid network connectivity.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following are customer responsibilities? (Choose two.)

options.text: Setting up server-side encryption on an Amazon S3 bucket
Physical security of data center facilities

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for securing their data and configuring network controls. This includes enabling S3 encryption and configuring security groups and firewalls. AWS manages the physical infrastructure.

questions.question: What is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan level that will provide users with access to the AWS Support API?
questions.explanation: The Business Support plan is the lowest tier that includes access to the AWS Support API. Developer and Basic plans do not provide API access.

questions.question:
A company has deployed several relational databases on Amazon EC2 instances. Every month, the database software vendor releases new security patches that need to be applied to the databases.
What is the MOST efficient way to apply the security patches?

options.text: Connect to each database instance on a monthly basis, and download and apply the necessary security patches from the vendor.
Enable automatic patching for the instances using the Amazon RDS console.
In AWS Config, configure a rule for the instances and the required patch level.
Use AWS Systems Manager to automate database patching according to a schedule.

questions.explanation: AWS Systems Manager can automate patching across EC2 instances according to schedules, making it the most efficient way to apply security patches.

questions.question:
A company wants to use Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) to deploy a global commercial application. The deployment solution should be built with the highest redundancy and fault tolerance.
Based on this situation, the Amazon EC2 instances should be deployed:

options.text: in a single Availability Zone in one AWS Region
with multiple Elastic Network Interfaces belonging to different subnets
across multiple Availability Zones in one AWS Region
across multiple Availability Zones in two AWS Regions

questions.explanation: Deploying instances across multiple Availability Zones within a Region protects against the failure of a single data center and provides high availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question:
A company has an application with users in both Australia and Brazil. All the company infrastructure is currently provisioned in the Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region in Australia, and Brazilian users are experiencing high latency.
What should the company do to reduce latency?

options.text: Implement AWS Direct Connect for users in Brazil
Provision resources in the South America (São Paulo) Region in Brazil.
Use AWS Transit Gateway to quickly route users from Brazil to the application
Launch additional Amazon EC2 instances in Sydney to handle the demand

questions.explanation: Placing resources closer to users reduces network latency. Provisioning resources in the South America (São Paulo) Region brings the application closer to Brazilian users.

questions.question:
An Amazon EC2 instance runs only when needed yet must remain active for the duration of the process.
What is the most appropriate purchasing option?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances are ideal when workloads run only when needed and must not be interrupted, because they have no long-term commitment and no interruption risk.

questions.question: Which AWS dashboard displays relevant and timely information to help users manage events in progress, and provides proactive notifications to help plan for scheduled activities?
questions.explanation: The AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides personalized alerts and guidance about AWS events that may affect a user’s specific resources.

questions.question: Which AWS hybrid storage service enables a user's on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS Cloud storage?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway connects on-premises environments with AWS storage services, allowing applications to use AWS cloud storage as if it were local.

questions.question: Which of the following acts as a virtual firewall at the Amazon EC2 instance level to control traffic for one or more instances?
questions.explanation: Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances, controlling inbound and outbound traffic at the instance level.

questions.question: What is the most efficient way to establish network connectivity from on-premises to multiple VPCs in different AWS Regions?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway allows scalable and centralized connectivity between on-premises networks and multiple VPCs across Regions.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides access to architectural and operational reviews, as well as 24/7 access to Senior Cloud Support Engineers through email, online chat, and phone?
questions.explanation: The Enterprise Support plan includes 24/7 access to senior support engineers plus architectural and operational guidance.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature helps restrict the AWS services, resources, and individual API actions the users and roles in each member account can access?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows administrators to use Service Control Policies (SCPs) to restrict which AWS services and actions accounts can use.

questions.question: What is the best resource for a user to find compliance-related information and reports about AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to AWS compliance reports, certifications, and legal documents needed for audits and regulatory requirements.

questions.question: Which Amazon S3 storage class is optimized to provide access to data with lower resiliency requirements, but rapid access when needed such as duplicate backups?
questions.explanation: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access stores data in a single Availability Zone, making it cheaper while still providing fast access, which is ideal for secondary or duplicate backups.

questions.question: What is an Availability Zone in AWS?

options.text: One or more physical data centers
One or more edge locations based around the world
A data center location with a single source of power and networking

questions.explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more physically separate data centers within a Region, designed to provide high availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used as infrastructure automation tools? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation and AWS OpsWorks are infrastructure-as-code and configuration management services used to automate infrastructure provisioning and management.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables users to create copies of resources across AWS Regions?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation can be used to replicate and deploy the same infrastructure across multiple Regions using templates.

questions.question:
A user would like to encrypt data that is received, stored, and managed by AWS CloudTrail.
Which AWS service will provide this capability?
questions.explanation: AWS Key Management Service (KMS) manages encryption keys and is used by CloudTrail to encrypt logs stored in Amazon S3.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud benefit eliminates the need for users to try estimating future infrastructure usage?

options.text: Easy and fast deployment of applications in multiple Regions around the world
Lower variable costs due to massive economies of scale

questions.explanation: Elasticity allows AWS resources to scale up or down automatically based on demand, removing the need to predict or estimate future capacity requirements.

questions.question: What credential components are required to gain programmatic access to an AWS account? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Programmatic access to AWS requires an access key ID and a secret access key, which are used by applications and CLI tools to authenticate API requests.

questions.question: Which of the following are AWS compute services? (Select two.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Lightsail and AWS Batch both provide compute capacity. Lightsail offers simplified virtual servers, while AWS Batch runs batch computing workloads.

questions.question: How can a company separate costs for network traffic, Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, and other AWS services by department?

options.text: Add department-specific tags to each resource
Create a separate VPC for each department
Create a separate AWS account for each department

questions.explanation: Creating a separate AWS account for each department allows clear cost separation and detailed billing per department without mixing usage.

questions.question: What is a benefit of consolidated billing for AWS accounts?

options.text: Access to AWS Personal Health Dashboard

questions.explanation: With consolidated billing, AWS combines usage across multiple accounts so they qualify for volume discounts, reducing overall cost.

questions.question: Which AWS service will allow a user to set custom cost and usage limits, and will alert when the thresholds are exceeded?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows users to define cost and usage thresholds and sends alerts when those limits are exceeded.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to detect inadvertent data leaks of personally identifiable information (PII) and user credential data?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie uses machine learning to detect sensitive data such as PII and credentials stored in Amazon S3 and helps prevent data leaks.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to monitor AWS service limits?

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator

questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks service limits and warns when resources approach or exceed AWS quotas.

questions.question:
A company has distributed its workload on both the AWS Cloud and some on-premises servers.
What type of architecture is this?
questions.explanation: A hybrid cloud architecture combines on-premises infrastructure with cloud resources, allowing workloads to run in both environments.

questions.question: Which of the following describes a security best practice that can be implemented using AWS IAM?

options.text: Disable AWS Management Console access for all users
Generate secret keys for every IAM user
Grant permissions to users who are required to perform a given task only
Store AWS credentials within Amazon EC2 instances

questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege means granting users only the permissions they need to perform their job, which improves security.

questions.question: What can be used to automate and manage secure, well-architected, multi-account AWS environments?
questions.explanation: AWS Control Tower automates the creation and governance of secure, multi-account AWS environments following best practices.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature allows a user to easily scale connectivity among thousands of VPCs?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway provides a hub-and-spoke model that scales easily to connect thousands of VPCs and on-premises networks.

questions.question:
A company needs protection from expanded distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks on its website and assistance from AWS experts during such events.
Which AWS managed service will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDoS protection and access to AWS experts who assist during active attacks.

questions.question:
A company's application has flexible start and end times.
Which Amazon EC2 pricing model will be the MOST cost-effective?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances use spare EC2 capacity at a lower price and are ideal for workloads that can tolerate interruptions, making them the most cost-effective option.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, what are the customer's responsibilities? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for protecting their data, including encrypting data in transit and ensuring data integrity, while AWS handles physical infrastructure security.

questions.question: A cloud practitioner has a data analysis workload that is infrequently executed and can be interrupted without harm. To optimize for cost, which Amazon EC2 purchasing option should be used?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances are best for infrequent and interruptible workloads because they are significantly cheaper than On-Demand or Reserved Instances.

questions.question: Which AWS container service will help a user install, operate, and scale the cluster management infrastructure?
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS manages the cluster infrastructure needed to run containers, including scheduling and scaling, without users needing to manage the control plane.

questions.question: Which of the following allows an application running on an Amazon EC2 instance to securely write data to an Amazon S3 bucket without using long term credentials?
questions.explanation: An IAM role allows an EC2 instance to securely access AWS services like S3 without embedding long-term credentials in the application.

questions.question:
A company with a Developer-level AWS Support plan provisioned an Amazon RDS database and cannot connect to it.
Who should the developer contact for this level of support?

options.text: AWS Support using a support case

questions.explanation: With a Developer Support plan, users can open support cases with AWS Support for technical assistance.

questions.question: What is the purpose of having an internet gateway within a VPC?

options.text: To create a VPN connection to the VPC
To allow communication between the VPC and the Internet
To impose bandwidth constraints on internet traffic
To load balance traffic from the Internet across Amazon EC2 instances

questions.explanation: An internet gateway allows resources inside a VPC to communicate with the public internet and allows inbound and outbound internet traffic.

questions.question:
A company must ensure that its endpoint for a database instance remains the same after a single Availability Zone service interruption. The application needs to resume database operations without the need for manual administrative intervention.
How can these requirements be met?

options.text: Use multiple Amazon Route 53 routes to the standby database instance endpoint hosted on AWS Storage Gateway.
Configure Amazon RDS Multi-Availability Zone deployments with automatic failover to the standby.
Add multiple Application Load Balancers and deploy the database instance with AWS Elastic Beanstalk.
Deploy a single Network Load Balancer to distribute incoming traffic across multiple Amazon CloudFront origins.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployments automatically fail over to a standby instance in another Availability Zone while keeping the same database endpoint.

questions.question: Which AWS managed service can be used to distribute traffic between one or more Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple EC2 instances to improve availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations on which of the following? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides recommendations to improve cost efficiency and system performance by analyzing how resources are used.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks can only be performed after signing in with AWS account root user credentials? (Choose two.)

options.text: Attaching a role to an Amazon EC2 instance
Generating access keys for IAM users

questions.explanation: Only the AWS account root user can close an AWS account or change the AWS Support plan. These actions are restricted for security reasons.

questions.question: Fault tolerance refers to:

options.text: the ability of an application to accommodate growth without changing design
how well and how quickly an application's environment can have lost data restored
the built-in redundancy of an application's components

questions.explanation: Fault tolerance means an application can continue operating even when individual components fail, thanks to built-in redundancy.
